Assistive_Text_Provider: Vega-Lite is a much more concise syntax for creating common visualizations, and is simpler for newcomers. It is recommended to start with Vega-Lite first, and then switch to Vega if you need more advanced functionality.
Assistive_Text_RenderMode: Specify how visuals should be rendered when processed. Canvas creates pixel graphics and SVG creates vector graphics. It is recommended to use Canvas if your visual needs to render many data points or marks, as this can reduce overhead on devices viewing the visual.
Button_Export_Dirty: Save your changes first to ensure that your specification is eligible for export.
Button_Help: Open help site in a new tab [Ctrl+Alt+H]
Button_Theme_Dark: Switch between dark and light mode (currently dark mode) [Ctrl+Shift+Alt+T]
Button_Theme_Light: Switch between dark and light mode (currently light mode) [Ctrl+Shift+Alt+T]
Button_ZoomFit: Zoom preview to fit available space [Ctrl+Alt+*]
Pivot_Dataset_HighlightField: This is the current Cross-Highlight value for [{0}], and provides a way to differentiate from the original (base) value vs. highlighted.
Pivot_Dataset_RowIdentifier: {0}: This represents the (zero-based) index of the internal dataset, and is used for interactivity reconciliation purposes.
Pivot_Dataset_Unknown: {0}: A field internal to the dataset, generated by Deneb. More can be found out in the documentation.
Pivot_Mode_Unknown: Select a debugging mode option from the toolbar.
Table_Tooltip_TooLong: This is a complex object, or is too large to display.
Template_Import_Not_Deneb: The supplied file's content is not a valid Deneb template. Please correct this file, or choose another valid JSON file and try again.
Template_Type_Descriptor_Bool: Template uses a boolean (TRUE/FALSE) value for this dataset field.
Template_Type_Descriptor_Text: Template uses a text value for this dataset field.
Template_Type_Descriptor_Numeric: Template uses a numeric value for this dataset field.
Template_Type_Descriptor_DateTime: Template uses a Date/Time value for this dataset field.
Template_Type_Descriptor_Other: Template uses an unsupported data type for this dataset field.
Text_Button_Import_File: Click to browse for a valid template file, or drag one here to import it. You can also paste a valid template from the clipboard (either as JSON or as a file).
Text_Create_Discover_More: Looking for inspiration? You can find more examples at the following locations:
Text_Create_No_Placeholders: There are no placeholders for this visual. Click the {0} button to begin editing the resulting specification.
Text_Create_Placeholders: Please assign suitable columns or measures from the Values field. It's recommended that you match the data type to the one shown for the template for optimal results. When all items are allocated, click the {0} button to begin editing the resulting specification.
Text_Create_Validation_Error: The supplied file is not a valid Deneb template.
Text_Dataset_FieldHighlightComparatorEq: "eq" = values are equal to each other
Text_Dataset_FieldHighlightComparatorGt: "gt" = Cross-Highlight value is greater than original value
Text_Dataset_FieldHighlightComparatorLt: "lt" = Cross-Highlight value is less than original value
Text_Dataset_FieldHighlightComparatorNeq: "neq" = values are not equal or directly comparable
Text_Dataset_FieldHighlightStatusNeutral: "neutral" = no cross-highlight is applied to the visual
Text_Dataset_FieldHighlightStatusOff: "off" = not actively highlighted (but Cross-Highlight is applied)
Text_Dataset_FieldRefer_Documentation: Refer to the documentation site for more detail on how this field can be used to assist you.
Text_Dataset_FieldSelectedNeutral: "neutral" = the visual has no current selection state and the data point should be displayed normally
Text_Dataset_FieldSelectedOff: "off" = the visual has an active selection state and the row is excluded from the list of selected data points
Text_Dataset_FieldSelectedOn: "on" = the visual has an active selection state and the row is included in the list of selected data points
Text_Debug_Data_No_Data: The specified dataset currently has no data to display. If your dataset responds to dynamic events, this will update to show the relevant data when such events occur; otherwise, you can select an alternative dataset to view its data.
Text_Debug_Data_Processing: Selected data set is being processed and formatted for the table. This may take a while for large data sets, but you can continue to use the editor while this is in progress. Please wait...
Text_Debug_Signal_No_Data: No signal data was found in the Vega view. Please ensure that your specification has parsed correctly and is free of errors.
Text_Dialog_Body_Version_Change_Subtext: The change log shows what's different between releases.
Text_Dialog_Body_Version_Increase: There has been an update since you last edited your specification:
Text_Dialog_Body_Version_Decrease: You're using an older version than this specification was originally authored in. Some features may not be available:
Text_Dialog_Notes_Remap: If you have removed or renamed a field from your dataset that is in use, this dialog will be shown automatically. This is to prevent you from having to find all occurrences of the field manually and update them. If you would prefer to do this manually, then you can click on the {0} button to return to the editor.
Text_Dialog_Instruction_Remap: The fields shown to the right have been identified as being in your dataset and have been used in your current specification. For one or more fields, you can use the dropdown next to it to remap it to a different column or measure. When finished, click the {0} button to apply the changes to your current specification.
Text_Dialog_Overview_Remap: Remap dataset fields that are in use more conveniently than having to hunt them down manually.
Text_Debug_Error_Config_Parse: There was an issue parsing the Config. Please confirm the Config is valid JSON and free from errors.
Text_Debug_Error_Spec_Parse: There was an issue parsing the Specification. Please confirm the Specification is valid JSON and free from errors.
Text_Export_Tokenizing: Updating your specification with placeholders for your dataset. Please wait...
Text_Overview_Create: A specification allows you to create a new design using either Vega or Vega-Lite. You can import an existing template, or create a new Vega-Lite or Vega specification.
Text_Overview_Export_1: You can export a JSON template that you can save elsewhere for others to use.
Text_Overview_Export_2: A template will include your visual's columns and measure metadata as placeholders for other users. NO DATA IS STORED, although, you may wish to provide more specific names for each field's purpose, as well as a description of its purpose to assist anyone using your template.
Text_Overview_Export_3: You have the option to include a preview image in your template. This image will be resized to a maximum of {0} by {1} pixels. By checking the box to include a preview image, you acknowledge that you have reviewed the image and you are sure that it is suitable for inclusion into your template. You also acknowledge that if you share this template outside your Power BI tenant or organization, this image may be visible to others.
Text_Overview_Export_4: Click {0} to save your template to a file. If your tenant admin has disabled downloading from custom visuals, you can also copy the template to your clipboard and paste it into a file or other application for you to save separately.
Text_No_Template_Selected: No template currently selected - please import a template, or choose from the list of included templates.
Text_Remap_State_Tracking: Checking and validating new field paths
Tooltip_Current_Provider: This is the provider you are currently using for your specification. The runtime version is also shown here, so that you can ensure that any features of the provider documentation are compatible with the version available in Deneb.
Tooltip_Export_Download_Disabled: Your host application does not support downloading of files
Tooltip_Tokenizer_Sync: Deneb is currently checking your specification and updating references to your dataset fields for templating and mapping purposes.
Tooltip_Zoom_Level: Current zoom level in the editor - use the controls to the left to adjust this as necessary
